definition: rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)

sentences.english: The right-hander allowed the first four batters he faced to reach base.
sentences.chinese: 這位右投手再面對投四名打者，全數讓他們進站壘包。

sentences.english: The third baseman made some remarkable stops.
sentences.chinese: 第三壘守壘員做了一些不可思議的攔截。

sentences.english: From now on, nobody will be able to steal a base.
sentences.chinese: 從現在起，沒有人可以“偷”壘了。

sentences.english: So how high would we have to pile the sandbags?
sentences.chinese: 那麼我們需要壘疊多高的沙包防洪呢？

sentences.english: Then the batter runs to one of the bases, depending on how far he hits the ball.
sentences.chinese: 接着打擊手根據自己把球打了多遠跑到其中一個壘。

sentences.english: Big stones were used for the walls.
sentences.chinese: 大塊的石頭呢就壘成牆。

sentences.english: Careers and lives are made one building block at a time, from the foundation on up.
sentences.chinese: 事業和生活是從打地基開始，一磚一瓦壘起來的。

sentences.english: He laid big stones at his house and began to build a pigsty.
sentences.chinese: 他把大石塊堆在房子前開始壘豬圈。

sentences.english: The player on second base was spiked by the runner on base .
sentences.chinese: 在第二壘的運動員被跑壘人的釘鞋踩傷了。

sentences.english: Third Baseman - Infield defensive fielder who covers the third-base area.
sentences.chinese: 防禦三壘壘包附近的內野手。

sentences.english: the music of the far-away summer flutters around the autumn seeking its former nest.
sentences.chinese: 遠遠往了的夏之音樂，飛行於秋間，覓求它的陳壘。

sentences.english: The invention discloses a brick for building an ecological afforesting wall.
sentences.chinese: 本發明公開了一種壘疊砌成生態綠化牆的磚。

sentences.english: In the courtyard to base a rockery, stone with what is good?
sentences.chinese: 想在院子裏壘一座假山，用什麼石頭好呢？

sentences.english: And that was when began his work with the stones.
sentences.chinese: 也是從那時起，他開始了壘石頭的工作。

definition: surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
to engrave (on wood or stone)/to inscribe
to neglect/to skip (class or work)/to waste (time)/vast/loose-fitting
to hold back/to restrain/to control (oneself)/to collect/Taiwan pr. [lian4]
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
